title: What's the title of an old electronic music song (early 2000s)? It has 'rock your body rock your body rock your body rock your body…move it' as the lyrics. - Quora

response.answer_text: I believe you’re looking for this song: Moby: “BodyRock” (from Play, 1999)  Born in New York City and raised in Darien, Connecticut, as Richard Melville Hall (the Melville from his great great great grand uncle Herman Melville, author of Moby Dick), was nicknamed Moby by his parents. Starting in 1988, Moby began his career as a Rock guitarist, but became fascinated with the technical aspects of the music and began mixing various compositions with studio electronics, beats and instrumentation. It worked. Starting with his single, “Go” in 1991 and continuing through his now long career, Moby has had tremendous success as a producer and performer of techno and electronic dance music and has become one of the most important figures of these and other alternative rock genres. His passionate adherence to Veganism and animal rights and his continuing charitable work have become almost as famous as his music. Here’s something he released earlier this year performed on The Late Show With Stephen Colbert: Moby: “This Wild Darkness” (from Everything Was Beautiful And Nothing Hurt, 2018)
